originalText.text: I’ve tried reaching out for a job placement urgently through ORO. Unfortunately I missed the first group. Multiple calls & emails no replies from Mr.Smith. He kept telling me he’ll get back to me it’s been days nothing how unprofessional. I’m still struggling to get a job. On/off the books.

originalText.text: I just did my taxes for the first time with a person named Luz or Lourdes and she was the epidimy of a hospital and humanitarian worker, She would be great as a supervisor because she has all the qualities !!!?

originalText.text: i signed up for the intern & earn program and i "wasn't picked" to continue and get a job placement. i spent unnecessary time and money for transportation, going there for the info session,  intake interview, back and forth to drop off documents, and the group interview. they made copies of ALL of my important documents (social security, birth certificate, etc) and the entire time i was under the impression that everyone who signs up will receive a job. NO ONE said at the end you would either be chosen to continue or not. im not disappointed that i wasn't picked, im disappointed that i feel lied to and i wasted a lot of resources on this. when i asked why they took all my information and didn't put me through, the lady claimed its a really competitive program and that only some people receive a job placement (WHICH AGAIN, AT LEAST LET PEOPLE KNOW THAT BEFORE/WHILE THEY'RE SIGNING UP). ive had multiple jobs and ive participated in multiple internships and i never went through such a strenuous process just to receive a no. so ladies and gentlemen, if you're looking for a job, i suggest you look elsewhere.

text.text: i signed up for the intern & earn program and i "wasn't picked" to continue and get a job placement. i spent unnecessary time and money for transportation, going there for the info session,  intake interview, back and forth to drop off documents, and the group interview. they made copies of ALL of my important documents (social security, birth certificate, etc) and the entire time i was under the impression that everyone who signs up will receive a job. NO ONE said at the end you would either be chosen to continue or not. im not disappointed that i wasn't picked, im disappointed that i feel lied to and i wasted a lot of resources on this. when i asked why they took all my information and didn't put me through, the lady claimed its a really competitive program and that only some people receive a job placement (WHICH AGAIN, AT LEAST LET PEOPLE KNOW THAT BEFORE/WHILE THEY'RE SIGNING UP). ive had multiple jobs and ive participated in multiple internships and i never went through such a strenuous process just to receive a no. so ladies and gentlemen, if you're looking for a job, i suggest you look elsewhere.

originalText.text: They had this big a** poster in front of the building saying Need a job We can help or some s*** like that. Went in the entire process for the internship ain't no on tell me u won't for sure get a job tf All the time I spent on this bullsh** Icould've spent in a different job actually workin
